rationale: The code uses MD5 (line 156) to generate a signature for todo items. MD5 is cryptographically insecure due to known collision vulnerabilities. Replacing it with SHA-256 provides a secure hash algorithm that is collision-resistant and suitable for cryptographic signatures. This is a minimal change that only affects the hash algorithm while preserving all functionality.
patch:
--- a/app.py
+++ b/app.py
@@ -153,7 +153,7 @@
     todo = Todo(title=title, complete=False)
     db.session.add(todo)
     db.session.commit()
-    sig = hashlib.md5(title.encode()).hexdigest()
+    sig = hashlib.sha256(title.encode()).hexdigest()
     print(f"Storing signature for todo {todo.id}: {sig}")
 
     return jsonify({
